core_exploration.central_question: How can we translate the essence of a live, immersive storytelling experience into a portable, accessible game format?
core_exploration.key_tension: Preserving the depth and magic of in-person library events while making them scalable and home-accessible
core_exploration.breakthrough_moment: Realizing that a card-based game could serve as a container to encapsulate the library experience
core_exploration.edge_of_understanding: Whether the card-based format can truly capture and deliver the full essence of the live events

conceptual_dna: Experience can be encapsulated and transported through thoughtful game design
Community storytelling needs structured containers to flourish in different contexts
The bridge between live events and home experiences requires careful translation, not just replication

bridge_potential.novel_synthesis: Translating live experiential events into portable game mechanics while preserving community storytelling essence
bridge_potential.cross_domain_pattern: Complex experiences can be systematized and containerized without losing their essential qualities

raw_essence: The creator has developed a method to capture the essence of live storytelling events in a card-based game format, allowing community experiences to be brought into people's homes. This represents a systematic approach to translating immersive experiences into portable, scalable formats.
embedding_text: storytelling game design, experience encapsulation, community events, card-based containers, live event translation, home accessibility, playtest methodology, immersive experience portability
